title: Bound Print, West-Front of the Pavillion, 1808
medium: Aquatint, brush and watercolor on cream wove paper
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink, lower left: H. Repton Esq. del; lower center: London Pub May 1, 1808 by J. C. Stadler, ? 15, Villiers Street Strand / West- Front of the Pavillion; lower right: J C Stadler sculp.
description: The façade of the west-front section of two pavilions is symmetrical in design. The bottom register consists of an open walkway divided by six columns, large greenery in each arch. Two towers with three levels showing Indian-style windows are topped with an onion-shaped dome. The towers flank the central portion of the pavilion with three tall Indian-style windows bordered with a scroll design. A large dome at top. A square tower at either end section.

tombstone.epitaph:
Bound Print, West-Front of the Pavillion, 1808. Aquatint, brush and watercolor on cream wove paper. 
1956-156-1-h
